intro: Castanopsis mianningensis, commonly known as the Mianning tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy dark green leaves and produces small, cupule-enclosed nuts. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in subtropical forest ecosystems. Castanopsis mianningensis plays an important role in maintaining biodiversity and soil stability in its native habitat.
